These labourers are clearing rubble from under the Eva Jocelyn, a ship carrying cement, when the storm surge created by typhoon #Haiyan, swept it on to the shore, crushing homes and shops. The owner wants to refloat it, using pulleys to drag to the water. Those who will be in the ship's path will have to uproot themselves again. #guardiancam #typhoonrelief #Philippines

Children at play in a @Unicef tent. Relief agencies place a priority on a safe environment for children in emergencies and such "child safe" places are a common sight in disaster response #guardiancam #haiyan #haiyanrelief #Philippines
Life goes on at San Jose, a beach village just outside #Tacloban city, as a couple saunters on the grey and black sand on a hot afternoon #guardiancam #haiyan #haiyanrelief #Philippines

Gomercino Sayong has been a coconut farmer for 29 years and lives in Camote village near #Tacloban city. Typhoon #Haiyan destroyed his 1,200 trees on the hillside behind his house. "For coconut farmers it's back to zero," he said #guardiancam #philippines #haiyanrelief

San Jose beach village near #Tacloban city. The homes on the beach were totally destroyed by the storm surge during typhoon #Haiyan. In many ways it is an idillyc spot by the sea, were it not for the threat of typhoons, the people there say they are ready to relocate as soon as the government finds them a place to go #guardiancam #haiyanrelief #Philippines
It's not just the west that has provided aid to the #Philippines after typhoon #Haiayn. #China is also getting into the humanitarian business #guardiancam #haiyanrelief

Romana Sarsalejo climbed up a hill in northern #Cebu and waited two and a half hours for a mobile signal so she could ring the authorities in Cebu city. 'How can I hold classes without help to rebuiild my school?' #guardiancam #haiyan #haiyanrelief #philippines

Practically every home in this community in the northern tip of #Cebu had its roof ripped off by typhoon #haiyan. People are using tarpaulins bought with money donated in the UK. High winds also lopped off tops of the coconut trees #haiyanrelief #guardiancam

Life has assumed a semblance of normality for some in #Cebu. These fishermen from the tip of the island have laid out salted sardines to dry, giving out quite a pungent whiff! #haiyan #philippines #haiyanrelief #guardiancam

The wind in northern #Cebu sounded like a ship engine that went on hours, said villagers. It swirled like a tornado twisting the tops of coconut trees into a tangled mess #guardiancam #haiyan #haiyanrelief #philippines

This flimsy wooden home was flattened by typhoon #Haiyan in November. "It rained and the wind blew for three hours," said Luisa Arog. They have built a crooked, rickety wooden structure next door.  The only surviving home in the community of 30 people was built of concrete #Philippines #Cebu
Things aren't looking good for the Broncos ... 29-0 in the 3rd quarter. - #guardiancam from @busfield
Seahawks stretching before #sb48 - @busfield
Broncos field goal practice #sb48 #guardiancam - @busfield
Follow #guardiancam for updates from the Super Bowl

We're wrapping up! With a photo of the door we go through every day, in the heart of the fast-changing London area of King's Cross, we end the Guardian Cities takeover of the #GuardianCam. Keep informed about everything related to cities and their past, present and future on our site, theguardian.com/cities, and be in touch on Twitter @guardiancities. We will be publishing a guide of urban Instagrammers soon. Thanks for all your comments and participation. Stay tuned! (Photo: @marta_bh)

#HongKong is the next destination for the Guardian Cities takeover of the #GuardianCam. Even though it is one of the most densely populated cities in the world, @siumomomo's feed is full of urban oases, peaceful spots and human interactions. This one was taken in a rooftop in Mong Kok (the busiest area in Hong Kong). Her favourite place in the city is Yau Ma Tei, a small district "with mixed culture and social classes: from the poor to the middle classes to the highly educated, they all live next door to each other", she says. This area also has "many local, very Hong Kong-style food stalls and street art". She recommends following @maubolung, the frontman of a Hong Kong band, and also @pan_tang, @deonwong, @momomomoc. What other Instagrammers from Asian cities would you recommend?

Next stop: #Mexico City. @lavicvic is an architect who captures moments from the daily life of this giant metropolis. She loves Mexico City because "it's the kind of city that becomes what you want whenever you want. You can find all kinds of magical moments in it". She likes her photos to be very clean and to play with colour compositions, textures and elements. 
Her favourite Instagrammers in Mexico are @elinsaciavle, @mikyalanis, @mylastnameistoolong, @elgatonegro_ and @pppaam. Would you recommend any other urban photographers from #LatinAmerica?

Moving on to the Czech Republic, the #GuardianCam falls into the hands of @prazakj. He posts pictures of #Prague and its surroundings and enjoys taking shots of architecture, like this one of the Main Point Karlin building. 
One of his favourite spots is Lake ‚Ä™Hostiva≈ô‚Ä¨, which he discovered recently and, he says, fascinates him. Some of his favourite Instagrammers in the Chech Republic are @tomasdvorak, @j1rk4, @jackob, @matescho, @sirondrej, @majkl_k, @domini_que and @hynecheck. What other urban photographers do you think are worth following in the area?

@justhanni is another urban photographer based in #Copenhagen. He tries to look for strong inviting subjects that catch the viewer's attention: "often these are roads, railway tracks, silhouettes, patterns or symmetry". He also enjoys taking shots of puddles and reflections every now and then.

He shoots a lot in √òrestad, a developing new urban district. "Some of the most interesting architecture, waterways and infrastructure are found here", he says. "It's a very modern part of Copenhagen, but at the same time close to nature and open spaces allowing for some good light". Some of his favourite fellow Copenhagen Instagrammers are @bobbyanwar, @cirkeline, @sondergaard, @nikolajthaning, @s1000, @geographable, @gittestark, @jesperbulow, @jlvm33, @82seba and @kennethnguyen. Who else would you recommend from the area?

#Copenhagen is the next city on the #GuardianCam's tour. @sondergaard's feed is an eclectic account of the city's life and vibe, with street photos, architecture shots and the odd sunset. "I love my city and I love catching the different moods, especially with the changing seasons", he says. 
His favourite spot is Kastellet, especially this time of year. "It's the almost 400-year-old citadel which Copenhageners now mainly use for walking and running trips". A lot of his photos tagged with #sondergaard_nakedtrees were shot there. He recommends following @mathias_milton, @bobbyanwar, @visitcopenhagen, @gittestark and @littlemycph. What other Instagrammers would you recommend from Nordic countries?

Here's an unusual shot of an obvious San Francisco landmark, the #GoldenGate bridge, as seen through the lens of @cafeaulei. Her favourite place in the city is Treasure Island, above the Bay Bridge, with the bridge lights and traffic below and the entire #SanFrancisco skyline to the right. "The bridge is so special to me because I was almost born in it", she says, as her mother went into labour while crossing it over. She also loves Hawk Hill, above the Golden Gate: "on a gorgeous foggy day you can see the entire city engulfed in fuffy white clouds!" Some other San Francisco Instagrammers she follows are @pketron, @moneal, @artchang and @throughthetinylens. Keep sharing your recommendations for urban photographers and stay tuned on theguardian.com/cities and on Twitter @guardiancities

Moving 9.500 kilometres to the west, the #GuardianCam lands in #SanFrancisco. The hills, the bay, the fog and the architecture make it a wonder for photographers. @lec101 tries to look for ethereal, magical moments that feel like refreshing escapes from city life, and says she is "forever mesmerized by the wild fog that is unique to San Francisco". Her favourite parts of the city are the little forests and the Outer Sunset district: "as a child I grew up surrounded by trees and open spaces, so I tend to seek out those environments within the city". Some of her favourite views of the city are seen through the eyes of @karlthefog, @travisjensen, @michiesharine, @junebugkim, @thatandrewkim, @chrisconnolly, @pketron, @ddent. Would you recommend any other urban Instagrammers in the West Coast of the #USA?

Cities are full of hidden gems, and the hustle and bustle of daily life can make it difficult to pay attention to them. @lidpop is a graphic designer who loves "Instagram's power to capture details and moments". He posts shots of unusual details from #Barcelona and other Catalan cities, such as Girona.

His favourite Barcelona locations are its streets - he loves to wander around and let the city surprise him visually. He also enjoys sharing ‚Äúlittle personal obsessions‚Äù with other Instagrammers such as #calendaribalconitis (balconies), #persianisme (shutters) or #labarcelonalletja (ugly Barcelona). Some Barcelona Instagrammers he follows are @martabcn100, @martimanya, @lalauri, @philmusical, @arasanz, @inistis, @gina_compte, @oriolvm and @gdel_arco. Who else would you recommend from the area?

The #GuardianCam now moves to the Mediterranean. Here, @barrut captured Pla√ßa de Sant Felip Neri, a charming little square in #Barcelona‚Äôs Gothic Quarter. He explains that he usually doesn‚Äôt look to capture anything in particular with the pictures; instead, ‚Äúthey capture me for different reasons‚Äù. He‚Äôs not hooked to his phone taking photos of every corner - he prefers to wait for a scene to catch his attention. He likes taking photos around the city‚Äôs coastline, and especially in the F√≤rum area, his favourite spot.

Other Instagrammers from Barcelona that he particularly recommends are @sanfigjo and @joelopez. What other great urban photographers do you know in Mediterranean cities?

Here's a very different #Vancouver photo, taken from Stanley Park by @maurice. His favourite place to photograph from is also this beautiful park: "it is mere minutes from the downtown core, but offers a variety of features including quiet forest trails, public beaches, gardens and city views by day and night. In many ways, it's a photographer's dream". Two of his favourite Instagrammers are @secretcities and @othellonine, our previous guest. Send our way your recommendations for other urban photographers and keep informed about all things cities on our site: theguardian.com/cities

The #GuardianCam moves to #Canada for our next guest photographers. You would never guess at first glance that most of the photos from @othellonine's feed are actually from a city. He benefits from the green spaces in #Vancouver, where he recently captured the fog in Central Park. His favourite spot in the city is Stanley Park: "the seawall, the views, the tall trees, the beaches..." Other Vancouver Instagrammers that he follows are @bittadesign, @dudelum, @secretcities and @maurice, among others. Would you recommend any other urban photographers from around Canada? #fogcouver

Continuing with the Guardian Cities takeover, our next #GuardianCam guest, @chaiwalla, is a London-based Instagrammer, although lately his feed has also featured other European cities like Lisbon or Dublin. He likes to document his surroundings, whether nature or urban architecture, and enjoys including people in the shots -"to keep the photo unique"- and capturing unusual spots such as the Horniman Museum and Gardens (pictured), in the English capital.

His favourite spot in London is the Monument, because "the 360¬∫ views are spectacular and, on a good day, you can see for miles". Also, since it's not enclosed, he explains, "there is no window reflection or glare to get in the way of the photograph". Other London Instagrammers that he follows are @tschang, @dearleila, @missunderground, @mattpike, @hellopoe, @zobolondon, @ecolephoto, @mrwhisper and @danrubin. Do you know of any other great UK-based photographers?

Journalists at the Republican retreat are so starved of access they're forming desperate scrums. The congressmen are meeting in a hotel resort half a mile from the small out-building reserved for media. No chance of a Hunter S Thompson stunt; we've been warned if we try to sneak in, we'll be detained by police, "de-credentialed" and marched off site. Paul Ryan just walked in and was surrounded by all the reporters in the room - he's refusing to talk, except to CNN, so everyone is just leeching on that. Some are standing on tables. The CNN interview supposedly embargoed for 30 mins. Fat chance.

Time for the #GuardianCam to travel to #RiodeJaneiro. @paulodelvalle is a designer who tries to "capture all the beauty of the city, showing beautiful spots and also the 'carioca' lifestyle". His favourite place in Rio is the Mirante Dona Marta, from where you can see breathtaking views: "On the left, you can see the Sugarloaf (pictured), and on the right the Christ the Redeemer". Two other Rio Instagrammers whose work he admires are @pripper and @minduim. What other photographers would you recommend from #Brazil?

#Amsterdam is full of beautiful urban scenes, and @p_d_y is a filmmaker capturing its daily life. His favourite spot in the city is the #Jordaan district, because "it's full of the things that make it an amazing city for a photographer: canals, bridges, small streets and historical architecture. It's what the locals like to call the 'real' Amsterdam". Other Amsterdam Instagrammers he follows include @sethcarnill, @regalphis, @panyrek, @maevdkrogt and @mariafranciska. What other #Holland photographers would you recommend?

To celebrate its launch this week, the Guardian Cities team is taking over this feed ‚Äîand #guardiancam!‚Äî through Friday. Urban Instagrammers from around the globe will be showcasing some of the best city feeds - and we hope to get to know many more talented photographers thanks to you. 
Kicking off, we've got @garethpon from #Johannesburg. His favourite spot to photograph in the city is #Maboneng Precint. For him, photography is not so much about shooting pretty pictures, but about "being as honourable as possible to capture in a single image the story that a moment wants to tell". Other Johannesburg Instagrammers he follows are @levonlock, @unclescrooch, @roywrench, @timvanrooyen, @alexioso and @ghostwitness. Who else would you recommend from around South Africa?

Obama has not finished speaking, but already reporters are poised in the #spinroom. Any minute now the doors behind the curtains will fling open and the big beasts of Washington politics will come stampeding out of the chamber, desperate for their own flash of limelight. #sotu #guardiancam via @paullewisreporter

Just 45 minutes to go and the nation's media is just about to get their seat in the House chamber. The atmosphere is giddy. Once we go in, the pics must stop #sotu 
#guardiancam pic from @paullewisreporter

A last minute #SOTU briefing for the very crowded press gallery including stern instructions not to take pictures (oops) and a video on the escape routes and hoods. Spot our @paullewisreporter paying careful attention. #guardiancam pic by @danroberts73

There are 314 million people in the United States. But Rev Patrick Mahoney was the only protester I saw on the Capitol grounds before the #sotu speech. The 'Saeed' on his placard is Saeed Abedini, an American-Iranian Christian who, exactly a year ago today, was imprisoned for eight years in Iran, reportedly due to his evangelical activities. Obama has raised Abedini's case over the phone with Iran's president Hassan Rouhani, but Rev Mahoney wants him to mention him in his speech. He admits the chances are "small". A #guardiancam by @paullewisreporter

What are you drinking tonight? The State of the Union is the Super Bowl for political junkies. As such, bars on the Hill are switching their TV networks and putting on drinks promos. At the 201 Bar, a favorite for Washington's hacks and flacks, they'll playing #sotubingo. #guardiancam #sotu

By @paullewisreporter.
Thinking of providing your own Stars and Stripes to fly over the #SOTU? Join the back of the line. #guardiancam by @danroberts73

Senator McCain is one of many Republicans already working on the #SOTU prebuttal. This is where Fox News have set up for the night and you can be sure the air will be thick with GOP talking points by the end of the night. #guardiancam pic by @danroberts73

But will he? The big question of tonight's #SOTU is not what Obama promises, which will inevitably be constrained by Congressional reality, but how he promises it. Many on the left would like to see him cut loose with angry rhetoric on economic inequality but the risk of losing moderate Senate seats in the midterms is weighing heavy on the minds of White House advisers. #guardiancam by @danroberts73

One of the best things about reporting on #TheHill is the #architecture. Most of all I love the tiled floors you get throughout the #capitolbuilding,
where Obama speaks from 9pm. (Via @paullewisreporter) #sotu #guardiancam

Wires: the curse of the modern journalist. Fortunately the House gallery has wifi and lets you bring in laptops - unlike the Senate which likes to freeze communications technology in 1970 or the Supreme Court which frowns at anything other than quills and parchment in the press seating. #guardiancam pic by @danroberts73

The House press gallery is starting to fill up too. Standing room only for many on the balcony through that door but at least those at the back are allowed to sneak out early for the police escort down to statuary hall afterwards. #guardiancam pic by @danroberts73

This old #AmericanBeech tree, with roots squished up against the path, has probably been around for most of history's #sotu addresses. Few people know that behind the #capitolbuilding (which you can see in the background) is a hidden gem of an #arboretum, containing native species from across the country. Don't know how old this particular tree is but some of these gardens were planted in 1820, when James Monroe was in the White House. In his #sotu of that year President Monroe said there was "much cause to rejoice in the felicity of our situation". A Republican, Monroe was anti-slavery, although he personally owned slaves, including some based at the White House. The last line of his #sotu - which, as was custom between 1801 and 1913, was written and read to Congress - stated: "In execution of the law of the last session for the suppression of the slave trade some of our public ships have also been employed on the coast of Africa, where several captures have already been made of vessels engaged in that disgraceful traffic." (via @paullewisreporter) #guardiancam
Can you feel the spin yet? The TV crews have made a right old mess of statuary hall but it's rare to see congressmen let anything stand between them and a video camera. #guardiancam @danroberts73

This Hogwarts-like entrance is from where Ohio Republican John Boehner will emerge to host this evening's #SOTU. The speaker told a party meeting this morning that sitting behind the president without letting any reaction show on the TV cameras made this the hardest day of the year for him, but he's already hinted that any attempt by Obama to circumvent Congress with executive action will bring a stern response from GOP lawyers. #guardiancam @danroberts73

Today, #capitolhill is as busy as I've seen it. Barely any space to move in the press room behind the #HouseOfRepresentatives chamber, where #Obama gives his #sotu tonight. Just over threw months ago, when I took this #regram, the US was in the midst of a government shutdown. The corridors of power were largely empty then, with many staffers on unpaid leave. #guardiancam #cannonhouse #capitolhill (Picture by @paullewisreporter)

This is Jeff. I met him outside #unionstation. Barack Obama claims reversing economic inequality is "the defining challenge of our time", a message he is expected to repeat during tonight's #sotu. The gap between people like Jeff, who told me he sleeps in a makeshift camp near the rail track (no heating, except for a candle) and America's richest has been growing continuously since 1979. More than half of the congressmen listening to Obama tonight will be millionaires. And despite all of Obama's promises, his first legislative action may be to sign the #farmbill, which cuts $9bn out of the food stamps program, which typically helps people like Jeff. House Republicans wanted a $40bn cut, which would have been the most drastic reduction in a generation. Pic from @paullewisreporter. #guardiancam #poverty #homelessness

We can't take pictures of this evening's #SOTU address from inside the chamber unfortunately but #guardiancam can try to bring you a feel for what all the pomp and circumstance is like surrounding it - including some of the loveliest ceilings in Washington. @danroberts73

Every reporter has his or her "kit". I keep mine stored neatly in a single pocket of my bag - and check it before I travel to big events like tonight's #sotu. Somehow, I'll need to transfer it all into my suit jacket. Yours, @paullewisreporter. #obama #washingtondc #dc #capitolhill #guardiancam

The piece of artwork I most hope catches Obama's eye as he walks in to deliver the #SOTU is this painting of Shirley Chisholm, the first African American woman in Congress, which hangs just outside the House chamber. #guardiancam @danroberts73

As well as Supreme Court justices, chiefs of defense staff and Michelle's special guests, there will be an absurd number of busts and statues surrounding Obama when delivers the #SOTU at 9pm EST in the chamber of the  House of Representatives. The first two are easy, but top marks to anyone who can identify all four. #guardiancam @danroberts73

This Statuary Hall where members of Congress and spin doctors will gather after the #SOTU speech to try to tell us what to think. Expect it to get much busier later. Reporters are escorted down by police before Obama has even finished. #guardiancam @danroberts73

We can't promise you the access of the staffers at @whitehouse who are also covering #SOTU on Instagram but we hope to offer a little less PR polish. This is Darrell Chappelle, an engineer on one of two underground railways in Congress, who has a long night ahead of him ferrying senators from their offices to the Capitol building. #guardiancam @danroberts73

Nancy Shepherd and Obi Henderson, small business owners in Charleston, West Virginia, discuss the aftermath of the Freedom Industries chemical leak with West Virginia Clean Water Hub volunteer coordinator Joe Solomon. Shepherd‚Äôs business, located in Cross Lanes, lost eight days of work. Additionally, her exposure to the contaminated water left her with irritated skin and severe nausea and vomiting for several days. Henderson described the scene in Charleston a few days after the leak was announced as being ‚Äúlike the Twilight Zone.‚Äù #guardiancam #WVWaterCrisis #WVChemLeak #WV @walkyourcamera

Andie Johnson, a third-grade elementary school teacher in Sissonville, explains how she and her husband, James, boiled snow so their youngest children Elie (pictured), 3, and Marlie, 2, could bathe. Older sister, Torie, 15, has been showering with tap water and has noticed some skin irritation after doing so. Several of the Johnson‚Äôs neighbors are pregnant and are concerned about the long-term impacts of the Freedom Industries chemical leak that has left more than 300,000 West Virginians without clean water. #guardiancam #WVWaterCrisis #WVChemLeak #WV @walkyourcamera
The John E. Amos Power Plant, a coal-fired plant located on the Kanawha River, near Nitro, West Virginia. #guardiancam #WV @walkyourcamera

Morgan Tury, of Nitro, West Virginia, holds his son, Jaxon, as he tells West Virginia Clean Water Hub volunteers they‚Äôre the first group to contact him after the chemical leak was announced more than two weeks ago. He and his fiancee have been bathing Jaxon with warmed bottled water, but they‚Äôve been showering with tap water. Tury is concerned about his 77 year-old mother, who lives in Fraziers Bottom in Putnam County, West Virginia, one of nine counties afftected by the Freedom Industries chemical leak. #guardiancam #WVWaterCrisis #WVChemLeak #WV @walkyourcamera

Candy Elswick, of Nitro, West Virginia, holds her grandaughter Jaylianna, 2, as she tells volunteers from the West Virginia Clean Water Hub about her struggle to get clean, safe drinking water since the chemical leak was discovered in Charleston on 10 January 2014. ‚ÄúWhen you‚Äôre poor, you can‚Äôt afford bottled water,‚Äù she told the volunteers. Last week, she took Jaylianna to a relative‚Äôs house in Jackson County (about an hour away) to bathe and shower. She hasn‚Äôt been able to cook or flush the toilets because of the toxic smell of the water. More than 300,000 West Virginians, like Elswick, have been affected by this leak. #guardiancam #WVWaterCrisis #WVChemLeak #WV @walkyourcamera

Keith Boucher and Kim McDonald of Nitro, West Virginia, have been without clean drinking water for more than two weeks. The couple have a 14 month-old son, Wayne, and Kim is five months pregnant. Volunteers from the West Virginia Clean Water Hub delivered bottled water, diapers, baby wipes, and hand sanitizer to the family on Sunday, 26 January 2014. Freedom Industries, the company responsible for the chemical leak on the Elk River, reloacted chemicals from that site to their Nitro facilitiy, which is just one mile from the Boucher-McDonald household. #guardiancam #WVWaterCrisis #WVChemLeak #WV @walkyourcamera

Breakfast with volunteers of the West Virginia Water Hub before heading out to distribute water in communities affected by the Freedom Industries chemical leak of a coal cleaning agent. More than 7,500 gallons of MCHM, or 4-methylcyclohexane methanol, leaked into the Elk River, contaminating the water supply of more than 300,000 residents in a nine-county area. More than two weeks later, residents are still struggling to access clean, safe water. #guardiancam #WV #wvwatercrisis @walkyourcamera
Coal-laden rail cars along the icy Kanawha River, just south of where the Gauley and New Rivers meet to form the Kanawha. #guardiancam #WV @walkyourcamera
Sunset on the upper Kanawha River, Fayette County, West Virginia. #guardiancam #WV @walkyourcamera
NO LITTERING. Sadly, this sign is located a quarter of a mile from Freedom Industries. The Elk River is in the background. #guardiancam #WV @walkyourcamera

Freedom Industries, site of the chemical leak that has left tens of thousands of West Virginians without clean drinking water for more than two weeks. More than 7,500 gallons of a coal cleaning agent, MCHM, or 4-methylcyclohexane methanol, leaked into the Elk River, contaminating the water supply of more than 300,000 residents in a nine-county area. #guardiancam #WV @walkyourcamera

The West Virginia State Capitol, Charleston, West Virginia, is located just three miles from the location of the Freedom Industries chemical leak. Shortly after the leak was detected and the extent of the damage became clearer, Freedom Industries filed for bankruptcy protection. Meanwhile, thousands of West Virginians remain unprotected and without safe drinking water. #guardiancam #WV @walkyourcamera

Good morning! My name is Roger May. Over the next couple of days, I‚Äôll be sharing photographs and stories of the people and communities affected by the chemical spill discovered in Charleston, West Virginia on 10 January 2014. More than 7,500 gallons of a coal cleaning agent, MCHM, or 4-methylcyclohexane methanol, leaked into the Elk River, contaminating the water supply of more than 300,000 residents in a nine-county area. More than two weeks later, residents are still struggling to access clean, safe water. #guardiancam #WV @walkyourcamera

My departing gift this week is a photograph I rescued as it was being discarded from the @washingtonpost newsroom, where I worked for a short spell in 2007. I found this pic in a trash can - along with three other library reprints - all apparently being cleared out of the photography archives. On the back, it says these are Howard University Students, protesting outside the National Crime Conference over its decision not to discuss lynchings in 1934. Anyhow, it has been taking over this account. Dan and I may be back next week, for behind-the-scenes pix from Barack Obama's State of the Union. In the meantime, have a good weekend. And remember you can follow my main account: @paullewisreporter #guardiancam #howarduniversity #historicpics #washingtondc

My last political #regram before handing the @guardiannews account keys back to the team in NYC is this shot of Congress on the night it decided to shut down the government. One of the many consolations of the long nights reporting this bizarre chapter was how beautiful Capitol Hill is - especially with no one in it. @danroberts73 #guardiancam

In the spirit of the #regram by @paullewisreporter this is a WWII battleship in Norfolk, Virginia that I caught while waiting for Bill Clinton to show up at a campaign rally for governor Terry McAuliffe. For some reason it really made me think of the unstoppable Clinton election machine sailing into town. @danroberts73 #guardiancam

The new face of the Republican Party, apparently. GOP outreach coordinators for African American, Latino, Asian American and youth voters/media giving a press conference at the RNC winter conference. Happy-looking lot.

This is a kind of #regram. I posted a different version on my @paullewisreporter account during my recent visit to #NorthCarolina, where I was writing about the impact of benefits cuts on the poor. I was driving near the border with Virginia when I saw what initially looked like a plume of smoke. I had never seen a #murmuration of such large birds before. I pulled over and shot this out the car window. Have to say that, like many journalists, I really enjoy being on the road. #guardiancam #birds #birdwatching

The mayors of Mesa, Sacramento, Baltimore and Philadelphia talking to reporters outside a frigid West Wing. Stephanie Rawlings Blake of Baltimore was so cold she could barely speak. #guardiancam @danroberts73
Lots of people like to take pictures of the president - even mayors. #guardiancam @danroberts73
Even the firewood is well ordered inside the White House #guardiancam @danroberts73
Join the military, tinkle the ivories. #guardiancam @danroberts73
Even under the White House portico, it is so cold that iPhone batteries die in seconds. #guardiancam @danroberts73
Some of the 200 US mayors trudging through the snow to listen to Obama in the East Room. #guardiancam @danroberts73
Ever wonder what it must be like to be a White House cleaner? #guardiancam @danroberts73
The White House is much bigger than it looks. It takes ten minutes and lots of gates to walk around to the secret service office to renew my pass. #guardiancam @danroberts73
View from the @guardiannews seat in the White House briefing room. As you can tell, it gets a bit drafty. #guardiancam
The White House television facilities, on the other hand, look like they could launch a 1960s moon rocket. #guardiancam
You need ladders to be a proper White House photographer but taxpayers may be pleased to note the government does not lavish money on our press room decor #guardiancam
There are four of us in the Guardian's Washington bureau: Suzie Goldenberg, @danroberts73, @attackerman and me (@paullewisreporter). This is our wall, a throwback to the analogue world. #guardiancam

Here is Bill De Blasio, at the #mayorsconference, an annual shindig for mayors, big and small, from across the United States. It is extremely hierarchical here, and  New York's De Blasio, the Big Beast, is working the room, bear-hugging and back-slapping other big city mayors. Meanwhile, small city mayors (with populations of 30,000) are left on the sidelines, next to me, taking pictures. One such mayor - from somewhere in Kentucky, I think - is the guy snapping De Blasio on his mobile in front of me. Looks like there are hundreds of mayors here. Right now I am sat between a mayor from Oregon and another from Florida, in an opulent ballroom. Both just took pics of the chandeliers on the ceiling. There will be more tourism later when all the mayors get to meet Obama at the White House. PS: You can follow my personal account here: @paullewisreporter #guardiancam #deblasio #washingtondc #politics

Arriving for pool duty (reporting not swimming) at a still very white White House. Pix from pooled events have to be shared with other reporters first but I'll try to pass on stuff through #guardiancam too. @danroberts73

This is Hayley Readinger, 15, from south east Kansas, who came to the #MarchForLife anti-abortion rally at #WashingtonDC's National Mall. She was there with her mom, Betsy. When I asked what motivated them to come all this way, Betsy said to her daughter: "Can I tell him?" Hayley nodded and Betsy continued: "She's adopted. Her mom walked out on planned parenthood." There were thousands - possibly tens of thousands - at the rally, most of them teenagers bused or flown in by church groups across the country. That was no accident. Organizers were deliberately encouraging young people to come. It was freezing - minus 12 Celsius/ 10 Fahrenheit. This #guardiancam comes from a very cold @paullewisreporter.

Today we were planning to bring you dispatches from the halls of power in #WashingtonDC. Alas, all federal buildings were closed, the White House cancelled its daily briefing and the State Department held a press conference over the phone. It was a government shutdown, induced by snow. So, instead, here is a #snowselfie I snapped on my way home. Yours, @paullewisreporter PS: Once the weather clears, we'll bring you images of our reporting around town. Tell us what you want to see.

New project alert! Whenever Guardian journalists are out and about, we'll let you know by using #GuardianCam. This week, we're kicking things off in the US, where much of America braced for a #snowstorm Tuesday. Our journalists in #NYC and #DC documented the dusting. Photos clockwise from top left: @moorehn, @ceciliamarie33 and @paullewisreporter.

#NYC #graffiti mecca and major tourist attraction #5pointz was painted overnight as its demolition day nears. The property owners want to build luxury condos. Do you have a similar story from your community?

The theme for our October reader photo competition was 'faces'. Reader Iselin Shaw captured this photo in Hoi An, Vietnam. "The language barrier then led us to have a 10-minute conversation consisting mostly of laughter."

We don't communicate with words alone. Have you captured a face that tells its own story? The theme of our October reader photo contest is 'Faces' and @guardiantravel wants to see your best photograph. Learn more: http://bit.ly/octobercontest (Photo: Philip Bigg/Alamy)
